website_summaries.verdict: It's technically obsolete, but Latin word roots are an essential component in a wide variety of career fields.
pros: A good beginner book for students
Systematically  introduces new concepts clearly and concisely
Engaging exercises at the end of each chapter
Includes access to website with accurate pronunciations
cons: Better suited for middle school than elementary or high school students

customer_reviews.title: A friend recommended this book and we got it from the library
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted to learn Latin this year (we homeschool) and since I never taken Latin myself, I was a little intimidated. A friend recommended this book and we got it from the library. I kept having to renew it, so finally decided to buy it. It's really easy to follow and we've both learned a lot. A great book if you are unsure if you are going to enjoy Latin or not or are intimidated about getting started. It's laid out very well for a beginner. I wish he had follow-up editions!
customer_reviews.author: Shane P Jones

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I'm teaching Latin to a 10 year old (she's just turned 11) and I'm using this book. Excellent results! While logically teaching the language, it gives the student a feeling of success through each lesson. Everything logically builds. My student has progressed past the middle of the book now. Not only does she translate Latin to English, but now also she is able to translate English to Latin. Of course these are simple sentences. I have one question - there seems to be no second volume! Does anyone have a suggestion for what I should use after we complete this book?
customer_reviews.author: Joan Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Geeking it up - great book
customer_reviews.text: Great book to get you started on Latin. Lessons are a manageable length and introduce just enough material to keep you interested without overwhelming you with. Segues nicely into the free online course. Only very minor criticism is that some of the declension tables have been scanned into the Kindle version and won't zoom properly.
customer_reviews.author: chris Young

customer_reviews.title: The way he lays out the concepts in such a systematic way is brilliant and not overwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Most beginning language books state that the learner does not need any knowledge of the language to use the book, but I have never found that to be true UNTIL THIS BOOK! The way he lays out the concepts in such a systematic way is brilliant and not overwhelming. He does not introduce a topic or word without good explanation of them, and then he gives exercise sentences to give you practice to learn the concept. I highly recommend this book for anyone wanting to learn Latin on their own or to teach it to their children. It truly can be used for those with no Latin background.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Getting started with latin was a great beginners latin book for me
customer_reviews.text: Getting started with latin was a great beginners latin book for me. I was intimidated and I wanted to learn, but the long and hard schooling for me is over and I didn’t think I could stick to a program. Turns out these exercises make it pretty easy, and for some reason I didn’t notice this when I bought it but you get free mp3 of pronunciation! Thank god. There are exercises and answers in the back, you can go as slow or as fast as you like. I did the first 7 exercises in about 20 minutes. Overall, definitely a good pick to dip your toe into latin.
customer_reviews.author: anisa alamia

customer_reviews.title: This is an easy method and I appreciate the uncluttered simple presentation
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy method and I appreciate the uncluttered simple presentation. I was able to successfully use this as a framework (in addition to other fun sources) for teaching my K-5th grade kids latin - they can actually produce sentences after a few lessons. Previously, I was mostly using rote memory, with a few sentences based on an in-cohesive vocabulary, but this book has enlivened and (amazingly) shortened our lessons. Now, the kids are excited because they are able to make their own (simple) sentences, and questions and answers.
customer_reviews.author: L.Pelton

customer_reviews.title: Great way introduction to learning Latin
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful introduction to Latin vocabulary, syntax, & grammar. It is written clearly & is easy to understand, & presents all material in a step-wise fashion, with review along the way, so you don't forget material already covered. Interesting tidbits about Latin expressions are interspersed throughout the book, which helps to keep things interesting & relevant. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is that there is no 'volume 2' to continue one's studies of the language. I haven't finished the book yet, but I will have to make a decision among other the Latin books on the market.
customer_reviews.author: techno-idiot

customer_reviews.title: The lessons are structured to make all words and phrases in Latin easy to relate to their equivalent to English
customer_reviews.text: The lessons are brief, but clear. The lessons are structured to make all words and phrases in Latin easy to relate to their equivalent to English. You can revisit the previous lessons for a quick review before progressing to the next chapters. I can't speak for people who have had some background in Latin, but for a complete beginner, I find it not only an excellent way to learn latin, but because of the ease of learning, it motivates me to keep up a daily regimen of progressing through the lessons.
customer_reviews.author: John Cheeseman

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner book for many different grade levels
customer_reviews.text: I really like this book. There are over 140 lessons included and mp3 files with pronunciations available for download. It is very much like a traditional textbook, with answer key in the back pages. I think for me, the lessons will stick from this book as I am able to translate, fill in the blank, etc. just like a workbook.
customer_reviews.author: AwesomeBEA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic beginner's book
customer_reviews.text: One of the best beginner's language books I've ever purchased. Lessons are short, to the point, and most importantly, build very logically on the previous lessons. It helps (but isn't required) to have studied one or more beginning Romance languages before (e.g. French, Spanish). My favorite feature would be short asides that take on what I did in the last sentence I wrote... ever wonder exactly what "e.g." means? :-) You'll find a treasure trove of explanations for Latin we use in every day writing, and without realizing it, expand your vocabulary in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Alsip

customer_reviews.title: Excelent book for the Introduction of Latin
customer_reviews.text: I took Latin in Highschool using tje Wheelock textbook. This book was a grwat refresher after 20 years. Nonetheless I recommend once you finish this to use the Wheelock for a more in depth understanding of the language.
customer_reviews.author: lagomorph

customer_reviews.title: Good intro for home or self teaching
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic introduction to the language. I now can say: You are not able to swim around the island, or, the sons of the farmer do not like to plow the fields,... in Latin! Each of the 134 lessons are less than a spoonful but probably just right for younger children. The audio (online) is helpful for pronunciation but does not add anything new to the course's content.
customer_reviews.author: MaldororTop Contributor: Painting

customer_reviews.title: Incredible book!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t finished it yet! But so far I love this book! It definitely gives you a really good foundation on which to begin learning Latin. This book has really taught me a lot. Not only teaching me Latin, but I understand other Latin based languages in a new light! I really wish this author would make books following this one. Such an incredible author!
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Anezil

customer_reviews.title: A great foundational book in learning the base language for all Romance languages
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed reading this book. It makes studying Latin fun and interesting. It explains the many Latin terms and abbreviations we use daily. I particularly like the summaries titled Latin Expressions such as the one on B.C. And A. D. This book also provides a good foundation for anyone who may be interested in learning any of the Romance languages such as Italian
customer_reviews.author: Crazy About Books

customer_reviews.title: Great for me, less great for my son
customer_reviews.text: I ran through this whole book as my first introduction to Latin (and foreign languages in general. I enjoyed it, did very well, and appreciated the gradual introduction of concepts - one word or concept per lesson, with review in every lesson. I’m going through this book again with my late elementary age son, but he is having more difficulties with it, not being able to remember the words from lesson to lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Rei

customer_reviews.title: Great book design
customer_reviews.text: Great book design. Starts of simply enough, but that is only to slowly build up on core concepts. Being able to make a sentence in Latin within three lessons is a great way to build self confidence and show results. This book should be done with the online material for maximum results. As the teacher explains each lesson he also sprinkles great grammatical lessons that are simple to grasp. For a beginner simplicity is the name of the game. Great experience. Oh! The materials online are free but the quality is great. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Leo Leo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I am an older adult wanting to learn Latin. This book fit the bill. It is so very interesting. You learn words and sentences along with English grammar right off the bat. It is done in small chunks so I think a young person would do very well with it, say 12 - 14 years old. That is, a motivated young person.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Coley

customer_reviews.title: Good refresher book
customer_reviews.text: The best of the Latin Kindle books for those who already have at least some grasp of Latin. I think my second year Latin class in high school was the last year my high school offered Latin since so many people were taking Spanish or French. I remember more from my Latin classes than any other classes in high school. It's such a diverse language that helps you with other languages/vocabulary. I bought this book just to touch up on my past education in Latin and it served that purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: WWTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Logical
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderfully laid out. I really appreciate the level of work that had to go into this to made it as seamless as it is. I can’t wait to get my kids started. We have tried two other Latin programs and this one seems to make the most logical sense with considering the natural funnel in which humans take in information and how to avoid concepts not sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S. Wolfson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome introduction
customer_reviews.text: We had been thinking about adding Latin to our homeschool but I just couldn't bring myself to spend more than a hundred dollars for something I just wasn't sure of. In my search I came across this and it has been AWESOME!! It's simple enough for anyone to just open and go, love that the answers are in the back and the lessons themselves are not intimidating but we really felt they were not dumbed down either. We used it over the summer and my older daughter just flew threw it. I'm now doing it with my younger child. Would highly recommend this program and the price is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Quality Latin Lessons
customer_reviews.text: This book is designed for teachers, homeschool students, or any students learning Latin. The lessons are sequenced and contain one vocabulary or grammar concept to master before moving to the next. The simple design can be used for teaching a 30-minute lesson since they include supports like bolded new vocabulary and a pronunciation chart.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Great for parents and kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in 4th grade and we are having a blast working through this book. The pacing is perfect: we do a few lessons each evening and the exercises reinforce things she is learning in school such as identifying subjects and verbs. No, we won't be fluent Latin speakers after reading this book. On the other hand, the book supports the idea that learning is fun and is a perfect fit for some quality daddy/daughter time. Please excuse my prose...Poeta ego non sum!
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Great start, missing infinitve verb push
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic book, if you pair Linney's book and website with some rudimentary language learning techniques (flashcards, etc.) this will give you a great start. My only problem with this book is that I was unfamiliar with the infinitive of each verb. This in a very minor thing as the infinitive is nearly never used and the book makes you very comfortable with many conjugations.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: A Good Intro
customer_reviews.text: A good book for beginners, this introductory guide to latin gets the job done. The exercises are pretty easy to keep up with and the book makes something that could be very overwhelming feel doable.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Valderman

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction to Latin
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this with my 8th grade son and couldn’t be happier. The pace isn’t too fast, but it doesn’t drag at all. I really like this and will use it with my other children too. Biblical languages was my minor in college and this is the best introduction of a language I’ve yet seen.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I took 4 years of Latin in high school. ...
customer_reviews.text: I took 4 years of Latin in high school. I would study for hours and still not understand. I did not understand the order of words and difficulty the entire time. I sure wish I had this book. I could have used it as a study guide because it explains the language and how it works and why.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great Starting Point for the Latin Beginner!
customer_reviews.text: This book is very great for those that want to get their feet wet on the Latin language which still serves a great deal in our society. Nothing wrong with much of what the book offers, but keep in mind: The book is way too big, most pages has lots of empty space. Doesn't cover all grammar rules of Latin. This book is a great starting book and would recommend it, it also offers free MP3 recordings online, but after finishing, especially if a Latin enthusiast, it's best to check out other Latin books as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler E.

customer_reviews.title: So much space wasted in this book
customer_reviews.text: So much space wasted in this book. If you put 2 lessons on some pages, It would easily be half it's size. The book itself is fun. I am a self learner and this is easy, however at one point when it's exceeding to the next level, it's like a huge jump. One moment i'm following along great and the next, I'm lost and can't keep up. It would be nice if it had some more beginner words and phrases.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nixon

customer_reviews.title: This book has been the perfect introduction to Latin and has allowed me to instruct ...
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yo homeschool student and I are 50 lessons in. This book has been the perfect introduction to Latin and has allowed me to instruct and learn alongside him without prior Latin background.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 4

customer_reviews.title: Easy and direct introduction to the language
customer_reviews.text: This is a thin and rather simple volume which offers a very gentle and rapid introduction to the basics of Latin. Its value is increased by the online audio lessons the author provides at no charge. Studying this volume will NOT make you a Latinist, but it will serve to get you a good beginning, and to help you determine whether you truly wish to go further.
customer_reviews.author: William Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy open-and-go Latin lessons for homeschoolers and self-taught students
customer_reviews.text: These are easy open-and-go lessons. I am a homeschooling mom and my son and I just started doing these lessons together and are very much enjoying learning Latin together. The lessons build on one another and provide just the right amount of review and challenge with each new lesson. We do one or more lessons per day depending on the time we have to work with. We have a solid foundation of English grammar, and we have memorized some Latin noun endings and verb conjugations which has helped.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mom

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Really great starter book for latin, for all ages. Step by step, with each lesson building on each other. I'm so happy I found this for homeschooling, it's a great introduction and I'm even learning too!
customer_reviews.author: Matador

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to get started in Latin
customer_reviews.text: I am halfway through this book and absolutely love the way it is done. It makes you delve right in to vocabulary, has appropriately brief explanations on each page, and downloadable material that supports the method of the book perfectly. Recommended for beginners of the Latin language!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually able to get my 12 year old to learn Latin with this book. He really does not like academic work but this workbook is simple, well-organized, and the each of the lessons are just the right "size" for him.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: excellent resource for its intended audience
customer_reviews.text: The negative reviews for this book were written by people who had some unrealistic expectations for a book subtitled "Beginning Latin for Homeschoolers and Self-Taught Students OF ANY AGE." This book is an excellent introduction to Latin for young children. Even for older students, it can be helpful to go through a gentle introduction such as this before diving into a harder book. If you're looking for a first year Latin program, this isn't it. OTOH, this is an excellent resource for its intended audience.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: You got this!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Easy one day a word or one day 2 words or concepts under my belt. Great way to get the Latin language under my belt. Late in life learners do not fear. If you have been a life long learner you got this!
customer_reviews.author: Marykatherine Moran

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little book to get your student learning Latin
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little book to get your student learning Latin. As long as they are familiar with the 8 parts of speech taught in English grammar, they should do well. Individual lessons are short with 10 sentences to translate. The author has downloadable audio to go with each lesson and gives pronunciation examples for classical and ecclesiastical styles. I was looking for something that wasn't too heavy for my 6th grader who is new to Latin and I'm glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: RobB

customer_reviews.title: Great book to catch up with Latin I.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic book for a beginner Latin student not it a school textbook, or a student who wants to review Latin I. It's very easy to follow and self-contained.
customer_reviews.author: Adventurene

customer_reviews.title: A great starter book
customer_reviews.text: I am throughly enjoying this book. It is very basic, and the author does not try to impress or confuse the student with his knowledge. Rather, while teaching Latin, he reviews elemenatry English grammar as you go along. This is done to ensure the reader understands basic concepts. The on-line audio links that accompany the book are especially helpful. These eliminate any questions about how words and sounds should be pronounced. A great starter book! Perfect for the beginner, adult, or just younger student who is interesting in learning something about the Latin language. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: V. J. Pafundi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: I took Latin in high school (MANY years ago), and found it very helpful. I'm now homeschooling my children and also teaching Latin to my nephew and nieces. I have many Latin books but none of them were quite right for teaching elementary school children. William E. Linney's book is perfect for homeschooling. The bite-size lessons are fun for young children and keep them from feeling overwhelmed. The pronunciation downloads are also helpful - and free!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love
customer_reviews.text: I took Latin in High School for a year and remember nothing. I have always wanted to learn Latin. This book is amazing. When I first started reading it I was sad that it only taught you a few words at a time, but I can say now it is the perfect pace and I have retained everything I've learned so far. I had to put it down for a few weeks as life got too busy, but when I did pick it up again I didn't have to backtrack and relearn anything. I would recommend this book to everyone starting out learning Latin! PS I have the Kindle version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed something to fill in the gaps for my daughter who is using Rosetta Stone. It was very confusing to weed through all the products out there, but because of some helpful reviews I decided to give this a try, I am so glad I did! We are satisfied with Rosetta Stone, however we just needed a little help with the forms in the Latin Language and this has been very helpful. It is very simple and just walks the student through the beginning basics such as; I am a sailor, he is a sailor etc. it is just what she needed to be able to do the written work.
customer_reviews.author: gweyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Latin Book
customer_reviews.text: This book teaches Latin in a simple, systematic way and provides ample repetition to promote and fortify learning. There is excellent online support for pronunciation, as well as quizzes. Most of the other Latin texts I have found have taken a more visual approach - developing dialog from what can be seen in a picture. This results in the premature introduction of exceptions and irregularities that make the study, for me, more difficult and confusing. The Linney text on the other hand, starts with simple, regular form vocabulary and reinforces the normal forms and rules firmly first and then gradually introduces the irregularities. Suits my style of learning very well.
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Real progress for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I started learning Latin for the second time - as a hobby. This book helps you to get a real start and feel a real progress.
customer_reviews.author: Jhk

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Super easy way to learn Latin. You don’t get overwhelmed because every new lesson introduces just one new word. I am about to order the next one:)
customer_reviews.author: Kickstar1

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this book and the free audio files from the ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this book and the free audio files from the website make pronunciation so easy! Decided to learn Latin after having becoming obsessed with gladiators from watching the series Spartucus.... Latin is a very cool language. I have taken German, French, Spanish and Russian throughout my school years and I think that Latin has just become my favorite language.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Brown

customer_reviews.title: So glad I found this book!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a homeschooling mom to one teenager and wanted a beginner's class in Latin that was easy to understand. THIS BOOK IS IT! It gives little bite sized pieces every day, starting with the ridiculously easy and slowly growing in difficulty as the lessons progress. My 16 year old son actually enjoys it!! And it is so easy, it's just amazing! I love it, too! I thought it was absolutely fantastic that they also offer free online downloads of all of the pronunciations (tiny, quick files) You just cannot get any more thorough or simple than this!! My only concern is what we do when we're finished with this book??? I so hope the author does a "part two"! :D
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent introduction to Latin
customer_reviews.text: I used this course as a refresher for my 4 years of high school Latin 50 years ago. It has a thorough and useful format that doesn't involve esoteric grammar and vocabulary. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: john lester

customer_reviews.title: We are on lesson 40 and really enjoying this. ...
customer_reviews.text: We are on lesson 40 and really enjoying this. My son is 8 , 3rd grade, and we are doing it together. We are both enjoying learning this less detailed approach and being able to bite off small chunks of Latin. He is also getting the hang of direct objects, subject/verb agreement in English and Latin etc all by doing a page a day of this curriculum. The mp3 recordings are very helpful but not necessary for every lesson. Just use them when you need them. We have tried 2 other Latin programs and just failed for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: M. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Book , Best way of Learning a Language, period.
customer_reviews.text: This book is exceptionally good and all languages ought to be taught this way. Please someone ask Mr. Linney to teach us German, Hebrew , Greek & Arabic using this technique. For the first time I am actually taking interest in language learning. Lord , help me. Also please contact Mr. Linney by email (if you bought the book) to ask him if he can transcribe his youtube videos on first course in Latin because I don't like listening to the lectures online. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur W

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son and it has helped him tremendously! The lessons are thorough but not overwhelming!
customer_reviews.author: thriftymom

customer_reviews.title: Five Star but Caution:
customer_reviews.text: the lessons are short and straight to the point. The lessons get you applying what you've learned right away. Caution: the usefulness of this book would greatly diminish without the downloadable files from his website. Before you purchase, I would download the files from the website first, just to make sure they are still available. Without the files you go from a 5 star item to a 3 star item.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Easy Latin for Homeschoolers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book as the primary Latin curriculum for my first grade homeschool student. It's simple to follow and each lesson builds upon the last. I am learning Latin with my first grader, and it has been easy to follow and understand(for both of us!). There's also free downloadable mp3s on the author's website to help with pronunciation. Getting Started with Latin makes learning the "dead" language easy and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: this book was recommended as an easy way to learn Latin
customer_reviews.text: Based on a previous review, this book was recommended as an easy way to learn Latin. Each lesson builds on the other and it is very easy to learn. Great book.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Product is as accurate and useful as the descriptions and reviews indicated it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Sloan

customer_reviews.title: A good start.
customer_reviews.text: This book is exactly what it claims to be, a beginner’s guide to studying Latin. The layout is straightforward and easy to follow. The lessons build on each other, and the audio files (included with the kindle version) are a big help. My one big complaint is the author recommends no specific resources on how one should continue to study Latin.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Streacker

customer_reviews.title: pretty boring. I would say it definitely heloed do ...
customer_reviews.text: Really informative book and helpful for lessons but it's in all honesty, pretty boring. I would say it definitely heloed do it's job though, get us started on learning Latin.
customer_reviews.author: DanieTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: It’s a dictionary
customer_reviews.text: Just a book with a list of words and their meanings. Not lessons per se.
customer_reviews.author: FutureMrsBLW

customer_reviews.title: Practice Makes Perfect
customer_reviews.text: During my elementary and middle school years, I had three Latin textbooks (that I remember). This blows them all out of the water. It's unique approach, emphasizing learning exactly one concept or word at a time, combined with more than 1500 exercises, mean that you really will master each concept as you go along. I've been reading it on my Kindle on the train for the past week, and I feel more comfortable reading Latin sentences now than I did at any point during any of my actual Latin classes. My one disappointment in this book is that it doesn't (yet) have a sequel. Good job, Mr. Linney!
customer_reviews.author: Mario D.

customer_reviews.title: This book is absolutely wonderful. It offers a user-friendly approach that works for ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is absolutely wonderful. It offers a user-friendly approach that works for any one, at any age. I have been looking for such as a precursor to introducing adults to ecclesiastic Latin, especially with respect to reading the Vulgate. Along with the fantastic mp3 recordings that may be found on the "Getting Started with Latin" website, this constitutes a comprehensive beginner's system. Optima!
customer_reviews.author: Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit biased since i've never studied latin before and this is the first book i got. The cover pretty much sums up anything i could say about it: Beginning latin, any age. It's very easy to use and understand and even though it's designed for homeschool children i didn't feel like the study was below my intellect so if you are learn latin on your own for fun i'd recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Silentium. Erras.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Introduction to Latin - Not a Latin Course.
customer_reviews.text: I don't speak Latin and this book certainly will not teach you. It is by far the best book on the topic I found. Here is what it does: It makes you familiar with certain concepts that are really per-requisites to learning Latin if one is so inclined. Of course, you learn a little Latin in the process, as that is its intention. Without something like this, just tackling Latin independently would be completely overwhelming. I have not seen anything like this other than this.
customer_reviews.author: Anĉjo Bruligas

customer_reviews.title: it goes along nicely as a beginners book
customer_reviews.text: Well, folks, I always wanted to learn Latin. Now I have that chance. In perusing the book, it goes along nicely as a beginners book. It's mind boggling to see Latin words in their relationship to other languages.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Look at all the other reviews!!  I agree with them.
customer_reviews.text: It is obvious that the author of this book LOVES TEACHING. I can sense it. The book accomplishes so much in such a fun way, and in a relatively short time. I find myself wanting to keep going to the next exercise. I just can't stop. I have the Kindle edition and highly recommend it for its ease of use and price. I wonder if this author has written (or is planning to write) the next level for this book. If so, I'll purchase it in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: V. Centeno

customer_reviews.title: thoughtful,  lively introduction
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent introduction to Latin--it should be thought of as a preliminary text. I found its method of presentation far more engaging than that of any introductory language text I've used--there is a minimal amount of vocabulary introduced and emphasis is on uniquely modular sentence structure of Latin. The author notes in the preface this text was developed for home schooling--and its not hard to imagine this book sparking younger student interest. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: paul jordan

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was made for a class called Intro to Latin. My 12 year old daughter loves it! She does a short lesson each day and is making progress with understanding and retention. There is also a free audio online so you can hear pronunciation - either classical or ecclesiastical. You click on the lesson and it says the new word, short and sweet. We are very pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: sugarplum-mom

customer_reviews.title: Very good and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A very good, very logical step by step guide to learning Latin. You may think that learning Latin is boring and useless, but not with this book.This guide is simple, easy to use and really helps open up your mind to the language.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Thank you William E Linney
customer_reviews.text: Thank You William E Linney for writting a book not just for profit. This book is wonderful and the online tutorials that you have posted to use with the book make learning Latin easy for ANYONE. The entire country could be learning and speaking Latin if they knew about this book and your system, it's time for an infomercial! Ode to William E Linney My prayers in Church were but mumbles My knowledge of Latin was weak I will now forever be humble My Lord to you in Latin I speak
customer_reviews.author: DIANE

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro to Latin.
customer_reviews.text: Super simple and easy to use. It is a great start to the language and my 3rd grader was interested in learning more. My favorite thing about it, it's not intimidating to teach. I also appreciate the links on the authors website to help with pronunciation and teaching. This is a great start and my favorite program I have used so far.
customer_reviews.author: Blindfish

customer_reviews.title: She said it is extremely useful and she has learned a lot
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old loves this book. She said it is extremely useful and she has learned a lot. It has inspired her to go further in her Latin studies.
customer_reviews.author: x10eho

customer_reviews.title: The presentation/layout is also excellent. No distracting snap
customer_reviews.text: Well done. Clear, well-thought out, starts slowly but increases at a quick yet appropriate rate. The presentation/layout is also excellent. No distracting snap, crackle and pop colors and images that occupy most of the page in many (or most) children's textbooks and workbooks.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: great starter latin curriculum!
customer_reviews.text: This is the end of our first week using this book. It is awesome. My 9 year old is one fire! The way things are introduced is genius...they are able to start translating and speaking in Latin right away. I would definitely recommend this book to anyone wanting to learn Latin. The mp3 downloads on the website ensure you use proper pronunciation.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Weaver

customer_reviews.title: An excellent place to start
customer_reviews.text: This book is everything you could ever want, if you're starting from zero and want to learn a little bit of Latin. With 134 one-page lessons, it moves quickly enough to keep you interested and with enough repetition to get things solidly into your brain. After consuming this book, I feel like I have a very solid (albeit somewhat thin) foundation that will serve me well as I move on to more traditional textbooks. If you are starting with little or no Latin, and you don't have a real live person to teach you Latin, you really want to start with this book.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick lessons!
customer_reviews.text: We use this Latin book along with the voiced lessons provided on the web site the author mentions. The voiced lessons really help us to have a consistency in our Latin word pronunciation. We are able to read, say, and write Latin up to lesson 30. We take 2 to 4 lessons a week. This book does a great job of review work. Most lessons end with Latin sentences for decoding. I and my daughters, 9 and 11, enjoy the slow/easy pace of memorizing Latin words. This is working for us.
customer_reviews.author: TXmomof2daughters

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use easy to understand. Fun little facts. Free online resources. Great book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great beginning Latin.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I are thoroughly enjoying this study of Latin. Consice lessons that work.
customer_reviews.author: hs4mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great for adult beginners
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book along with the Minimus book for students and it's accompanying CD. I bought this book more for myself. I never took Latin in school but want to learn it. The book's format is very basic and I love the fact that the author has a website that offers links on how to pronounce the words in the book. That is a must if you've never had Latin! I recommend this book for any adult and teenager who is looking to learn Latin on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: EASY STUDY!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT SHIP AND ARRIVAL. We started this text as soon as it arrived. We found ourselves interpreting "He is both a sailor and a farmer" and He is not a poet or a sailor, he is a farmer." within the first hour! We couldn't believe it! Now we will start with chapt.1 and a notebook and work through the book daily for eclesiastical study and as part of our child's (and adults) home study education. THANK YOU for this "Beginning" study! What do you recommend next?
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: Good for home-school 7 yr. old
customer_reviews.text: I really like the simplicity of this book so far. Great that it has audio for each lesson. I am a beginner myself using this for my 7 yr. old son that I home-school.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Rucando

customer_reviews.title: Regardless of age, this is a fabulous instructional book!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Comprehensive, clear and simple way to learn this beautiful and effective language. This is a repeat read for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Another Latin Tool that works
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves all the books that were purchased to help her master Latin
customer_reviews.author: Nona Batiste

customer_reviews.title: A Handy Tool for Review of Latin
customer_reviews.text: Helpfully organized and presented. I use it for refreshing my memory of the Latin I loved as a teenager.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 7th Grader Was Beaming
customer_reviews.text: My son has been struggling with Latin class this year(7th grade) and I got him this book to supplement his school material. He came to me smiling and enthused, declaring that he finally understood a lot of stuff he'd been fuzzy on and was really excited. He had been in the doldrums and I think it has given him renewed confidence to continue on more invested in his Latin studies.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Book!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is one of the best books out there for learning a language. It’s easy to understand and follow. It’s full of fascinating information. I never thought I’d learn Latin, but it has opened a new world to me.
customer_reviews.author: nancy Cohick

customer_reviews.title: How does one review a text book?
customer_reviews.text: It worked, I like the lesson speed and I think it is the best choice on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: latin for grownups trying to help their kids
customer_reviews.text: I got this book in order to learn enough of the basics to enable me to help out my son in his freshman latin class. Unfortunately, I didn't realize how difficult it was! I know how to speak Spanish, so the verb conjugation style was familiar to me. This book does a wonderful job simplifying components and gradually adding new material. I would have like more of the common vocabulary words to be included regularly instead of just every once in a while. I also think it would be helpful to include a list of the latin roots of words - the building blocks of all the romantic languages.
customer_reviews.author: jean herlihy

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Book!! Easy to Follow!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase this book after reading how good it was. I was skeptical but soon realized it is a fantastic book.! Its very easy to use with the web site in case you need assistance. I have started using it for my children ages 5 and 10 and am happy to report that they have been learning with ease. I recommend this book to anyone with an interest in learning Latin but is worried about the difficulty that most feel when thinking of learning/teaching a new language.
customer_reviews.author: The Girl  Next  Door

customer_reviews.title: great for homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: excellent book with easy to grasp lessons and helpful practice questions. I am homeschooling my 3 year old and we are learning Spanish, Tibetan and Latin together. He likes the book and learning Latin, he loves to introduce himself to strangers with "Sum Cassady!"
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Love this book!!!
customer_reviews.text: Such a GREAT book!!! Easy to use. The kids *could* do it themselves, but I wanted to do it with them! It only took 10-15 minutes a day and gave them a solid foundation in Latin and beefed up their grammar as well. I can't say enough about it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Summerville

customer_reviews.title: Latin on the GO ¡¡¡¡
customer_reviews.text: a very easy and sensible aproach to learning latin, I bought it to teach myself and it has been a total success, its easy , very logical and intuitive way to make your first contact with Latin; also as a given bonus since Spanish is my native language I have been given a very interesting insight of the essence of many terms that build the structure of my language, I strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Nefario

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I bought this book. Its easy to build up your vocabulary and the lectures that you can download from the author are really, really helpful with pronunciation. I bought this to help me understand the Latin Mass more and the pronunciations. I will definitely buy other books from this author in the future when I am finished with this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great homeschool resource
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am enjoying this book. It teaches Latin words and phrases in a simple, straightforward way. My eight-year-old daughter is enjoying it as well. Great homeschool resource
customer_reviews.author: Gregory L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro
customer_reviews.text: As a guy who had Latin in high school, 25 years ago, this book was a GREAT way to simultaneously review some basics, and teach my 7 and 10 year-old daughters. The lessons are split into tiny chunks, with lots of repetition. We spend about 15 minutes a day on it, which is perfect. The down-loadable lesson files are very helpful as well. Between this book and the Minimus books, we are having fun, and learning a lot. Thanks, Mr. Linney!
customer_reviews.author: American Elm

customer_reviews.title: Have no experience with Latin whatsoever? - Then get this book! (a list of content follows)
customer_reviews.text: This book contains lessons in the following subjects: 1) The First Declension. 2) The Second Declension. 3) Adjectives of the First and Second Declensions. 4) The First Conjugation. 5) The Second Conjugation. 6) Ablative of Means. 7) Both Classical and Ecclesiastical Pronunciations.
customer_reviews.author: Salomon

customer_reviews.title: I think it works best when paired with a class
customer_reviews.text: I had an enjoyable time learning from this workbook! I think it works best when paired with a class.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Bathurst

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best Latin, teaching book ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best Latin, teaching book ever! You will know how to read, how to write, how to pronounce, and how to understand your first tear Latin . I'm 75 years old. I understand these easy bite size lessons, and you will too.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Hamster

customer_reviews.title: Great resource!
customer_reviews.text: This book, along with the corresponding free audio recordings, is a truly wonderful resource for those starting to learn Latin. I'm so glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: AmzCust

customer_reviews.title: An excellent Latin primer
customer_reviews.text: Anyone willing to tackle the beautiful and eternal Latin language for the first time needs to have this book. Mr. Linney breaks down the 1st two declensions into digestible chunks, allowing the student to master each phase of study at his own pace. I am almost finished with the text, and I am looking forward to moving on to more advanced Latin textbooks. Be sure to visit Linney's website and take advantage of the free downloads and commentaries available there. Thank you and salve, Magister Linney for providing this wonderful language resource to learners of all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Hefter

customer_reviews.title: Language is the most important thing to learn.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this book for my grand daughter and she is learning the language. We believe in learning languages as an integral part of life. The majority of the people in the world outside of the US speak multiple languages and we believe that children should do the same here.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Viers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent introduction to Latin
customer_reviews.text: I studied Latin throughout high school and when I began to homeschool my 6-year-old daughter I looked for a good introductory text. I certainly found it! The slow pace is great for younger students and builds confidence (older students can work faster if they wish) but the major pedogogical innovation is how the book introduces grammar and vocabulary slowly and most of the book uses only first declension nouns and first conjugation verbs (except for sum and possum) which eliminates the paralysis that can affect an English-speaking student encountering the rather more complex system of declension and conjugation characteristic of Latin. A fantastic book, all around.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Austin

product_meta.title: Getting Started with Latin: Beginning Latin for Homeschoolers and Self-Taught Students of Any Age (English and Latin Edition)
